channel.title: Silabs client help
channel.description: Yeah this is gonna be nooby :eek: so brace yourselves: i run silabs client and i start fiddling and spawning items all good but i can't spawn over the number 10,000 and if i try and change the command to fix this i still get the same problem so could someone please provide me with a code for a perfect pickup command i beg you -Sanga

item.title: Silabs client help
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

pickup works now… cred to monkey wacko (sorry if spelt wrong)

here it is

			else if (command.startsWith("pickup")) {
				try {
					int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12));
					int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));
					if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) {
						addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
					} else {
						sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Excist");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");
				}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Silabs client help
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

If it’s crashing thats because you haven’t adjusted the values in the item.java and the client.java. For instance I changed these in my item.java

[code] public static int SmithingItems[][] = new int[5][5];

public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[11999];
public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[11999];
public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[11999];
public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[11999];
public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[11999];
static {[/code]

and… theres too many things spread out throughout the client.java to paste them all, but essentially you would modify values like this…

if (Item.SmithingItems[i][0] > 20000 || Item.SmithingItems[i][0] < 0) {
if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {

and such.

Read full topic

item.title: Silabs client help
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

There isn’t a perfect pickup command, depending on your server source you may have to tweak yours differently than others. I got mine working last night after 2 hours of adjusting all my server files… including changing the values of 10000 to 20000 in item.java booleans and in the client.java… I’ll show you my pickup command though, it works for my server source, I have no idea about yours.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”)) {
try {
int newItemID =

Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11));
int newItemAmount =

Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12));
if (newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No Item in Database”); }
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Invalid Item ID”);
} [/code]

FORGOT TO SAY when using ::pickup to spawn an item over 10000 do not put an amount next to it… so…if you wanted the quest cape you would type ::pickup 10770

but if you wanted an item below 10000 like… money ::pickup 0995 100000

Read full topic
